One-Liner: Restrict predictions to plausible species using regional checklists, geofencing, and class masking.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want predictions restricted to species in my region so I don't waste time on impossible IDs.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want geofenced results so partner reports only include locally plausible species.

Card Title: Honest Results at the Right Level
One-Liner: Roll up to genus or family when the model is uncertain — coarser-but-confident predictions beat wrong species IDs.
User Story 1: As a taxonomist, I want the system to roll up to genus when it can't confidently identify to species, so results are honest rather than wrong.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want confidence-appropriate results in reports so partners trust the data.

One-Liner: Configure, deploy, and manage ML pipelines — model registry, processing service UI, reprocessing, active/inactive pipelines.
User Story 1: As a project manager, I want to choose which ML pipelines run on my data without developer help.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want to register new models and track their lineage in the platform.

One-Liner: Estimate and display how confident the system is about each prediction using accuracy metrics per species, region, and camera.
Status Summary: 4 tracked in GitHub; 5 partially implemented; 1 untracked
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to see how accurate the model is on my specific data so I know when to trust it.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want auto-generated accuracy reports so I can include reliability statements in publications.
User Story 3: As an ML researcher, I want per-class confidence calibration so I can identify where the model needs improvement.

One-Liner: Use multiple detections of the same individual across frames to improve species identification of occurrences.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want the system to combine evidence from multiple photos of the same insect to get a more reliable ID.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want temporal tracking to aggregate classification scores across detections for better occurrence-level predictions.

One-Liner: Filter out blurry, cut-off, or too-small detections before classification so results aren't polluted by junk.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want the system to skip images that are too blurry or partial so I only review real observations.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want cleaner results by default so species counts reflect actual biodiversity, not image artifacts.

One-Liner: Ship sensible defaults that hide noise — confidence thresholds, non-insect class hiding, and per-project configuration.
Status Summary: 1 tracked in GitHub; 1 partially implemented; 1 untracked
User Story 1: As a new user, I want the system to show useful results out of the box without needing to configure thresholds manually.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want project-level default filters so my team sees clean results without individual setup.

One-Liner: Reduce duplicate detections, handle more camera types, and skip non-insect artifacts in high-volume scenarios.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want fewer false detections so I spend less time dismissing non-insects.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want the detector to handle overlapping detections better so downstream classification isn't confused.

One-Liner: Get the new async processing pipeline running and tested with partner data for real-world feedback.
User Story 1: As a project manager, I want reliable automated processing so results arrive without manual intervention.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want to test new models on partner data to validate improvements before wider rollout.

One-Liner: Resolve trust-killing issues: password reset, dangling jobs, processing failures, and milestone #27 items.
Status Summary: 4 tracked in GitHub; 7 partially implemented; 4 untracked
User Story 1: As a user, I want to reset my password without contacting a developer so I can recover my account independently.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want processing jobs to complete reliably without hanging indefinitely.
User Story 3: As any user, I want basic platform operations to work consistently so I can trust the system with my research.

One-Liner: Let new users go from 'I have images' to 'I see results' in minutes with a single guided form.
User Story 1: As a new user at a conference, I want to upload sample images and see results immediately so I know if Antenna works for my data.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want to create a project with minimal setup so I can evaluate the platform quickly.
User Story 3: As a project manager, I want a demo project that showcases the platform's capabilities to potential partners.

One-Liner: Suggest which occurrences to verify for maximum calibration value instead of verifying everything one by one.
User Story 1: As a taxonomist, I want the system to suggest which identifications need my attention most so I use my time efficiently.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want to know when I've verified enough to trust the overall results so I can stop checking every record.
User Story 3: As an ML researcher, I want to identify which verified records would be most valuable for model retraining.

One-Liner: Make jobs complete consistently — fix timeouts, improve error handling, and add progress visibility.
User Story 1: As a project manager, I want to see real-time progress of processing jobs so I know what's happening.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want failed jobs to recover gracefully instead of losing all progress.

One-Liner: Create, edit, and assign regional species lists to projects for class masking and result filtering.
Status Summary: 4 tracked in GitHub; 6 partially implemented; 3 untracked
User Story 1: As a taxonomist, I want to maintain a regional species checklist so predictions are restricted to plausible species.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want to assign different species lists to different deployments based on their location.

One-Liner: Upload images from cameras and import externally processed data without developer help.
Status Summary: 6 tracked in GitHub; 12 partially implemented; 1 untracked
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to upload images from my camera's SD card to the platform without command-line tools.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want to import detection results from another system so I can use Antenna for verification and analysis.

One-Liner: Retrain and deploy regional models using partner-verified data to improve accuracy for specific use cases.
User Story 1: As an ML researcher, I want to retrain the classifier on Panama-verified data so results improve for tropical species.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want a regional model tuned to my camera's data so accuracy reflects my specific conditions.

One-Liner: Fix password reset, sign-up flow, and basic role management so users can manage their own accounts.
Status Summary: 1 tracked in GitHub; 4 partially implemented; 6 untracked
User Story 1: As a user, I want to reset my password via email without needing developer assistance.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want to invite team members and assign roles so the right people have the right access.

One-Liner: Step-by-step documentation for common workflows: project setup, reviewing results, exporting data.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want a guide that walks me through setting up a new monitoring project from start to finish.
User Story 2: As a new user, I want tutorial videos or walkthroughs so I can learn the platform without live training.

One-Liner: Installation guides, configuration docs, and one-click deploy options for community self-hosting.
User Story 1: As a university IT admin, I want clear installation docs so I can deploy Antenna for our ecology department.
User Story 2: As a community user, I want a one-click deploy option (Digital Ocean, etc.) so I can run my own instance.

One-Liner: Technical docs for building integrations, custom processing services, and contributing to Antenna.
User Story 1: As an ML researcher, I want API docs so I can build a custom processing service that integrates with Antenna.
User Story 2: As a developer, I want contributor guidelines so I can add features to the open-source project.

One-Liner: Export occurrence data in Darwin Core, CSV, and other formats for GBIF submission and ecological analysis.
Status Summary: 2 tracked in GitHub; 1 partially implemented; 15 untracked
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to export my data in Darwin Core format so I can submit it to GBIF.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want CSV exports with flexible column selection so I can use the data in R or Python.
User Story 3: As an ML researcher, I want to export training data with annotations for model development.

One-Liner: Improve the image gallery with better navigation, filtering, linking between views, and keyboard shortcuts.
User Story 1: As a taxonomist, I want to navigate between occurrence detail and session views with one click so I can review in context.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want to filter the gallery by species, confidence, and date so I find what I need quickly.

One-Liner: Visualize species occurrence over time — flight periods, seasonal patterns, abundance trends, co-occurrence.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want phenology charts showing when species appear so I can compare across years.
User Story 2: As a conservation decision-maker, I want abundance trend graphs so I can assess population changes.

One-Liner: Rework image collections into dynamic, filter-based datasets for flexible grouping and batch operations.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to create a dataset from filter criteria (date range, deployment, species) so I can batch-process specific subsets.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want dynamic collections so I can create training sets that update as new data arrives.

One-Liner: Fine-grained roles (viewer, reviewer, admin) and object-level permissions for multi-team collaboration.
User Story 1: As a project manager, I want to grant reviewers access to verify identifications without being able to change project settings.
User Story 2: As an admin, I want to manage team membership and permissions per project so each team controls their own data.

One-Liner: Better tools for managing monitoring stations, sites, devices, and temporal event grouping.
Status Summary: 2 tracked in GitHub; 10 partially implemented; 1 untracked
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to manage multiple camera stations with their locations and time periods from the UI.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want to see which deployments have recent data and which need attention.

One-Liner: Improved taxonomy tree navigation, display names, common names, and parent-child relationship management.
Status Summary: 7 tracked in GitHub; 3 partially implemented; 14 untracked
User Story 1: As a taxonomist, I want to browse the taxonomy tree and see common names alongside scientific names.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want to navigate from a species to all its occurrences across my project.

One-Liner: Fix layout issues, improve date pickers, make responsive design work, and standardize component patterns.
User Story 1: As any user, I want the interface to be consistent and predictable so I can learn it once and navigate confidently.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist working on a tablet, I want the UI to work well on smaller screens.

One-Liner: Improve CI/CD, monitoring, logging, and deployment automation for reliability and developer productivity.
User Story 1: As a developer, I want reliable CI/CD so I can deploy with confidence.
User Story 2: As an admin, I want monitoring dashboards so I can detect issues before users report them.

One-Liner: Support lab microscopes, specimen drawers, and other non-camera-trap image sources.
User Story 1: As an entomologist, I want to process specimen drawer photos so I can digitize museum collections.
User Story 2: As an ML researcher, I want to use Antenna for lab microscope images so one platform handles all insect imaging.

One-Liner: Expand beyond moths to pollinators, general insects, and broader ecological monitoring use cases.
User Story 1: As a field ecologist, I want to detect pollinators visiting flowers so I can study plant-pollinator interactions.
User Story 2: As a conservation decision-maker, I want general insect monitoring data, not just moths.

One-Liner: Connect with iNaturalist, GBIF, and external ML platforms for data exchange and community science.
User Story 1: As a community scientist, I want to sync observations with iNaturalist so both platforms benefit.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want automatic GBIF submission so our data is publicly discoverable.

One-Liner: Clustering support, multi-model ensembles, active learning loops, and advanced post-processing.
Status Summary: 3 tracked in GitHub; 10 partially implemented; 27 untracked
User Story 1: As an ML researcher, I want to run multiple models and ensemble their results for better accuracy.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want the system to actively learn from corrections to improve over time.

One-Liner: Support multiple organizations on shared infrastructure with proper isolation and resource management.
User Story 1: As an admin, I want to host multiple organizations on one deployment with proper data isolation.
User Story 2: As a cloud operator, I want auto-scaling so the platform handles load spikes during processing.

One-Liner: Exploratory work: new ecological metrics, experimental UI patterns, academic collaboration features.
Status Summary: 1 tracked in GitHub; 2 partially implemented; 15 untracked
User Story 1: As an ML researcher, I want experimental features behind feature flags so I can test ideas without affecting production users.
User Story 2: As a field ecologist, I want to pilot new analysis methods on my data before they become standard features.

One-Liner: Forums, shared resources, community events, and collaboration tools for the broader Antenna ecosystem.
User Story 1: As a community member, I want a forum to share experiences and help others set up their monitoring programs.
User Story 2: As a project manager, I want to discover and connect with other teams using Antenna in my region.

One-Liner: Capability inventory: features already built and shipped. Not on the board — for context only.
